Uses of Class
ikor.math.Decimal

Packages that use Decimal
ikor.math   
 

Uses of Decimal in ikor.math
 

Methods in ikor.math that return Decimal
 Decimal Decimal.abs()
          Returns a Decimal whose value is the absolute value of this Decimal, and whose scale is this.scale().
 Decimal Decimal.add(Decimal val)
          Returns a Decimal whose value is (this + val), and whose scale is max(this.scale(), val.scale()).
 Decimal Decimal.divide(Decimal val, int roundingMode)
          Returns a Decimal whose value is (this / val), and whose scale is this.scale().
 Decimal Decimal.divide(Decimal val, int scale, int roundingMode)
          Returns a Decimal whose value is (this / val), and whose scale is as specified.
 Decimal Decimal.max(Decimal val)
          Returns the maximum of this Decimal and val.
 Decimal Decimal.min(Decimal val)
          Returns the minimum of this Decimal and val.
 Decimal Decimal.movePointLeft(int n)
          Returns a Decimal which is equivalent to this one with the decimal point moved n places to the left.
 Decimal Decimal.movePointRight(int n)
          Moves the decimal point the specified number of places to the right.
 Decimal Decimal.multiply(Decimal val)
          Returns a Decimal whose value is (this * val), and whose scale is (this.scale() + val.scale()).
 Decimal Decimal.negate()
          Returns a Decimal whose value is (-this), and whose scale is this.scale().
 Decimal Decimal.setScale(int scale)
          Returns a Decimal whose scale is the specified value, and whose value is numerically equal to this Decimal's.
 Decimal Decimal.setScale(int scale, int roundingMode)
          Returns a Decimal whose scale is the specified value, and whose unscaled value is determined by multiplying or dividing this Decimal's unscaled value by the appropriate power of ten to maintain its overall value.
 Decimal Decimal.subtract(Decimal val)
          Returns a Decimal whose value is (this - val), and whose scale is max(this.scale(), val.scale()).
static Decimal Decimal.valueOf(long val)
          Translates a long value into a Decimal with a scale of zero.
static Decimal Decimal.valueOf(long unscaledVal, int scale)
          Translates a long unscaled value and an int scale into a Decimal.
 

Methods in ikor.math with parameters of type Decimal
 Decimal Decimal.add(Decimal val)
          Returns a Decimal whose value is (this + val), and whose scale is max(this.scale(), val.scale()).
 int Decimal.compareTo(Decimal val)
          Compares this Decimal with the specified Decimal.
 Decimal Decimal.divide(Decimal val, int roundingMode)
          Returns a Decimal whose value is (this / val), and whose scale is this.scale().
 Decimal Decimal.divide(Decimal val, int scale, int roundingMode)
          Returns a Decimal whose value is (this / val), and whose scale is as specified.
 Decimal Decimal.max(Decimal val)
          Returns the maximum of this Decimal and val.
 Decimal Decimal.min(Decimal val)
          Returns the minimum of this Decimal and val.
 Decimal Decimal.multiply(Decimal val)
          Returns a Decimal whose value is (this * val), and whose scale is (this.scale() + val.scale()).
 Decimal Decimal.subtract(Decimal val)
          Returns a Decimal whose value is (this - val), and whose scale is max(this.scale(), val.scale()).
